Reviews.Title: “Getaway lounge deal”
Reviews.Author: wilfredcsp
Reviews.Content: Most fantastic check in experience in this 48 bedroom boutique hotel, superb hotel room with extremely comfortable bed and bathroom. continental breakfast also came with hot bacon and eggs that can ordered for free. Plenty of awesome takeaway places around the hotel too. This hotel is on par or even better than many of the 5 star hotels I've been too. Wangz made 2 happy travellers :)

Reviews.Title: “WANGZ”
Reviews.Author: KennyF24
Reviews.Content: Extremely well designed and built hotel,built with top notch materials and fittings. Bedrooms very well done,very nice and very comfortable bed.Lobby,restaurant and bar also very well done.Staff were extremely friendly and knowledgable but not constantly in your face and standard of housekeeping was the highest I've ever seen.All around ,pound for pound, the best hotel I've visited and will definately stay there whenever I go back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annabela L
Reviews.Content: My bro found this hotel on tripadvisor because of all the positive reviews.This is a really nice boutique hotel which I think its service worth more than it's priced. Although the rates were not low, but the interior design, the staff, the bed and the bathroom were all fantastic. The twin room we stayed was on the fifth floor. The view from our room was pretty nice with trees and a school in the opposite. The room was not as packed as in other hotels I have been to. The bathroom and the bed were very clean. Love that they provided you free local newspaper every morning. This really feels like home for me. Despite got a bit bored with having eggs every monring for breakfast, I had a very pleasant stay at the Wangz Hotel. Oh, the only thing should be improved is that there is no socket in the bathroom. There was only one for the shaver but not for me to use the hair dryer. So I could not blow my hair in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, comfortable clean and good service.”
Reviews.Author: Callum M
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, booked because of reviews on here and was not disappointed. Yes the MRT station is a walk, yes taxis are hard to find on wet afternoons but then this is the same as most hotels. Bed was great, shower was fantastic, there was a good selection of tv stations and breakfast was lovely. Only comment I would make is that the light and music system takes some learning. Definatly A hotel for the savey traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: CJWSydney
Reviews.Content: Staff really friendly. Good location, within reasonable walking distance to metro. Double glazing keeps noise out well from the busy road below. Clean, nice decor. Great brekkie except the coffee very bad.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: flyingnun07
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights mid-March, 2012 on a stopover between Europe and Australia. I do this 4 times per year so have consequently stayed at many hotels across Asia, especially in Singapore. As a solo traveller, there are several things I look for when booking a hotel; cleanliness, security, comfort, internet access and value for money. Wangz fulfilled these criteria and more. Being a small hotel the staff were able to give one the impression of personal service rather than being another source of income on the conveyor belt of tourists in a larger impersonal hotel. The room was immaculate (no hesitation to do yoga on the floor), the bed a welcome comfort, the included extras such as breakfast (perfectly good enough), internet access and mini bar were just what I needed to handle the jet-lag. There are many restaurants in the vicinity including some good cafes on Tiong Poh Road and Eng Hoon Street. Head further afield into Chinatown if you are looking for vegetarian food. Buses are cheap and efficient (you can buy a transport card at the Cheers convenience store 100m from Wangz) and stop outside the hotel. Don't let the location with major roads running past the hotel be a deterrent. Unless you are used to living in a country location with no traffic noise, then this won't be a problem. The rooms are well sound proofed. Ear plugs are wise accessories when traveling and at Wangz I felt safe enough to use them enabling me to sleep long and deep.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: Sallytompkins
Reviews.Content: i enjoyed my stay at he wangz hotel, the staff were fantastic, very welcoming and helpful, the rooms, clean, modern and very comfortable. hotel shuttle service was great. on the down side i had a room with mesh covering window, so no view.

Reviews.Title: “Mi encanta / i love it”
Reviews.Author: izizwan
Reviews.Content: General: The hotel is perfect for those who are looking for a quality boutique hotel . My wife and I enjoyed our 3 nights there. Location : It is located at the most antique part of the city, where most public transportation are available. The hotel took an initiative to provide shuttle services to wherever we wanted to go. No problems for tramsport whatsoever Rooms/ Habitation: Stylish, comfortable and up to date as expected. Very private and fantastic greenery ambience Service / Servicio : Pleasant, accomodating and always willing to help proactively. Food variety could be better to reflect the diversity of songapore's food culture Conclusion/ Resumen: I would definitely recommend to those who are looking to stay something different yet at reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk+metro to the action - recommend”
Reviews.Author: whiteduck
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2011 Formula 1. Spacious room, great welcome and daily complimentary soft drinks / water from the minibar made this perfect. 10-15 minute flat but humid walk to Outram Park MRT and then two (air conditioned) stops to Raffles Place - easy! Breakfast was relaxed with a good selection of Asian and Western food with eggs cooked to order. Friendly front-of-house staff who took a real interest. Recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Honestly? Just Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: jbuckingham1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in Feb and didn't have a single complaint. Could stroll to the marina in about 30mins through China town but there are loads of taxis outside and they have a shuttle service to orchard rd. Price wise, it is it cheap? no, but hotels are expensive over there and overall it is relatively great value compared to other hotels in Singapore. Other larger hotels might have more facilities but it had everything I needed only with the personal touch of a smaller hotel. For example the guys at the reception all took the time to remember my name and were all up to speed on my stay. If you are reading these reviews to put your mind at ease about the service let this be the review to confirm that the folks at the hotel beak their backs to make you feel welcome and make your stay as comfortable and worry free as possible. They really can't do enough for you and I think that is where this hotel is head and shoulders above its competition. I loved my time here, I loved the hotel, I loved Singapore and I will definately stay at Wangz again (if only to see Gin the rather beautiful and enchanting lady at the breakfast bar again who I may have had a little crush on). Thanks for a great stay Wangz : )

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Sascha81
Reviews.Content: Good things about this hotel are service was good and everybody really friendly and helpfull, room was decent and really stylist, clean and neat. The rooftop bar was nice if you want relaxing time. about restaurant didnt try at all but menu looked fine. The rates wasnt so bad because include breakfast and wifi. The only problem that i got is hotel location. not all taxi drivers know location of this hotel, if you are knew in Singapore, make sure you bring map. or you can take MRT, its a little bit far but still okay to walk. one more info, hotel dont have lobby. so when you got here, you need to stop to basement parking lot and take lift straight to reception area/ restaurant. All from that, Wangz hotel is small and right on the corner but its really worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay”
Reviews.Author: Raj b
Reviews.Content: It is a small boutique hotel with very good rooms but definately not worth the money, for this amout you can get a much better hotel on orchard road. The location is a little off but the rooms are really nice.

Reviews.Title: “warm cozy quilts and pillows”
Reviews.Author: jalebi
Reviews.Content: You won't want to get out of bed - the quilt is so soft and comfortable. The room is stylish, not large but adequate for 2. The bathroom has a very sleek look and molton brown toiletries. The location, we thought, was wonderful - near Chinatown, and right next door to a dim sum shop with awesome pork buns. The ride into center of Singapore is not long. The included breakfast was good but nothing spectacular - better to grab some Chinese food next door. The one thing to keep in mind in Singapore - it rains and rains a lot. And although taxis are plentiful, when it is raining, could take an hour or two to find one. Memorize the taxi number from the outside of one and call - much easier than flagging one down. The hotel staff is very helpful and will call taxi for you. Restaurant Tip : No Name Signboard seafood restaurant - known for their white pepper chili crab. Food was excellent. Not inexpensive but worth it. They have several locations. The one closest to hotel was Vivocity Mall.

Reviews.Title: “Tucked in a quaint neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: pongster
Reviews.Content: It was my first staycation at Wangz Hotel. I enjoyed the friendly service at the reception. SImon made it a point to find out more about myself. He also provided dinner options which was much appreciated. Room wise, it's cosy enough for 1 or 2 persons. I was on the 6th floor so I had a magnificent view of Tiong Bahru, one of Singapore's quaint neighbourhoods. Since it was a personal staycation, I thoroughly enjoyed reading by the window on the single chair and sipping my fave coffee. You can find Molton Brown as part of the shower amenities. Some drinks are complimentary (apart from water). Breakfast selection is limited but it's probably due to the small number of rooms/guests as well. I had bread and pastries, cereal, fruits and coffee, which made my day anyway. I checked out the rooftop bar on level 7. It has a panoramic view of the expressway and the Outram area. Quite lovely to wind down after a long day. Across the road are some indie cafes that I always love. Forty Hands and Orange Thimble are two of my faves. I wouldn't walk from the MRT as they're both quite a distance away. I took bus 63 from Tiong Bahru MRT (2 bus stops) and it stopped right in front of the hotel. Bus 33 goes there too. From the same bus stop, you have access to town as well. I saw signs of free shuttle to various tourist attractions from the hotel but didn't get to take it. All in all, lovely place

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & value”
Reviews.Author: nixgreen
Reviews.Content: Boutique hotel with a focus on service. Staff were very helpful and take a lot of pride in what they do. Free wifi is a plus when other hotels in Singapore are charging $30-$40/day. Free mini bar is a nice touch too. Not much directly surrounding but it is a central and convenient location with MRT in walking distance. Good value. Happy to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, contemporary style”
Reviews.Author: Rick_Johnson
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Wangz on a few occasions over the past 18 months. I've always found the staff to be exceptional, in any capacity they have been needed in. The hotel's arguably boutique. Every room I've ever stayed in has been stylish and modern. It may be too stark for the taste of some, but not for me. Everything you need is provided. Nice complimentary toiletries. Internet available. Safe. Robes. Flat screen TV. DVD's available from reception. You should probably keep in mind that you need to close the blinds in the room at night, unless you like scaring the people outside... I believe there's a small gym downstairs too, but I did not use it. Breakfast was ok. Singapore is a food mecca anyway, so go and explore. One of the best steamed bun shops in the city is right next door too, and there's several seafood restaurants within a 3 minute walk. Bus stop outside. Or grab a taxi if you'd prefer. The underground is around a 15 minute walk away. The location's not perfect for most tourists, but Singapore's easy enough and small enough to get around wherever you end up staying. A 10 minute SGD$10 taxi ride may save you a couple of hundred on a similar room elsewhere. One of the best clubs in Singapore - Zouk - is just down the street too. I keep returning here as I find the value it offers is hard to beat in Singapore. I'd be surprised if you find reason to disagree with me.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JellybabyBabe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is by far the best we have ever stayed in! It was very clean and as I have a passion for interior design, I loved the design of this hotel. As soon as we stepped through the door the staff could not do enough for us. And for a designer hotel the price was very cheap. The rooms were very comfortable and I loved the rain shower. I also liked that soft drinks in the mini bar were free and there was free wifi. We will definitely stay in Wangz when we return to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely modern boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrunkLove
Reviews.Content: We booked this as a last minute place to stay while visiting Singapore for a few days, and could not be happier with our choice. The hotel is about a 5-10 min walk from the MRT, so good location. Room was lovely; clean, modern, and with a stunning bathroom with large viewing windows over the city, certainly not for the shy. All the usual perks you'd expect from a top hotel were present - Strait Times newspaper tucked under your door each morning, Wifi, good choice of tv channels, good room service, etc. Breakfast choice was a little limited, but can hardly complain. The staff were very helpful and gave us tips on getting around Singapore. If visiting here, you must try the rooftop bar, which was strangely deserted when we visited, but was still delightful. Not the cheapest hotel in Singapore (or the most expensive!) but excellent value. Would be ideal for a romantic couple, or a businessman (if you can the company to expense it!)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Osiris77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wangz during a 4 days retreat to Singapore and booked a comfortable twin room. The hotel is small and modern designed. I would not call it a boutique hotel for any other reason than having only 40+ rooms, but it has a nice design. The Front Office associates were friendly and did everything to make us feel comfortable. We had a small incident during breakfast on our first day and the hotel management was so generous to offer wonderful compliments throughout our stay. All in all, the hotel is nice and comfortable. The rooms are clean, spacious and modern. The only two things we would recommend to take action on are 1) to reduce the intesity of the scent in public areas. The smell is too strong and during breakfast rather not so pleasant. And 2) An all-day breakfast option and extended room service hours. 24/7 room service, even with limited choice, would certainly upgrade the product. Lastly, two particular people should be mentioned here who made our stay truly worthwhile: Jin who just started 3 weeks ago in service and Sufian, the shuttle driver who always tries his best to please his guests. All associates were friendly, but those two receive special recognition from us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, food and service”
Reviews.Author: DanoCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely, futuristic-looking hotel with a modern décor and furnishings. The rooms are bright and clean with floor-to-ceiling windows, original art, and a large comfy bed. Wifi is provided free of charge throughout the hotel. The room has a good-sized work desk, a fridge with free water and sodas, a kettle and selection of teas, and a large flat-panel TV with a good number of channels. Eclectic original art pieces by contemporary artists are dotted throughout the hotel and in each room and add a stylish “nature” theme to the modern décor. The hotel is close to Chinatown, about a 10-minute walk to Singapore’s fab rapid transit metro system (MRT) and provides a free shuttle service to the Orchard Park shopping district, Raffles, Marina Park and Chinatown. The partially enclosed rooftop bar and restaurant has great night views of the Singapore skyline and the food is a first-rate mix of French and Asian cuisine. The complimentary breakfast had a great selection of fruit, pastries, cereals, bacon and even smoked salmon. Eggs and omelettes can be ordered to taste and so can espresso coffee. An excellent selection of new age and easy rock music is played in the lobby restaurant, the rooftop patio bar, and in the rooms (where you can adjust the volume or turn it off). On the downside, there is no readily visible front entrance, as the building is squeezed into a triangle at the intersection of two busy streets. What entrance you can find is hidden up a flight of stairs and is not well marked. Our taxi driver had to circle the hotel a couple of times to find out where to park. The taxi drop-off is accessed via the basement off a little lane behind the hotel. Inside is parking for only a few cars. A poorly marked doorway leads to the elevator that takes you up to the lobby. There is a larger parking lot across the street for those with their own car. Once you have checked in, however, excellent service and quality take over. Staff are friendly, efficient and welcoming. Access to your room is secured by placing your room key over a small pad on the elevator control panel. This is to prevent restaurant and bar patrons from accessing the guest rooms. It’s a nice comforting feature. On the third floor the hum of traffic from the two busy streets was drowned out by the A/C fan and we slept quite well. The ultra-modern glass-wall shower and bathroom were spacious, bright and clean, and a rain showerhead provided lots of hot water and good pressure. One of the best features was the way staff treated us like friends or regular guests. There were always attentive, friendly and addressed us by name after the first day. They went out of their way to ensure that we were always comfortable and well looked after. This would be a great place for a longer stay or for business people who want space to work with the comforts of home.

Reviews.Title: “Original, but not boutique”
Reviews.Author: hubhopper
Reviews.Content: We arrived five hours before our 2pm check-in and were immediately asked if we'd like to take breakfast at no charge started the stay well. The room we'd booked was still occupied and we were offerred, and accepted, an alternative (upgrade) which was adapted for disabled travellers and was on the second floor. A huge ceiling to floor window dominates the room but there is little by the way of a view. A huge blown-up photo of parrots over the bed and a couple of ornaments fit for a car boot sale were more kitch than boutique. Although the room was on a low floor and looked out over the back of some restaurants and had a busy road running by it was very quiet at night and we slept well. Do use the rooftop bar for an evening drink, the views are amazing. The bit of distance from the city centre and the dark space provided by the park give a great perspective of Singapore. The staff throughout the hotel were very professional and friendly. The 10 minute walk to Outram Park MRT isn't bad if you're mobile and has some shade from trees in the hot weather. Having said the room was adpted for disabled travellers a ceiling to floor glass sliding door to the bathroom was very heavy and a fixed glass screen next to grab rails don't allow a wheelchair to be pulled alongside the toilet. I'm not sure this would meet UK standards on accesibility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice one but with little flaw”
Reviews.Author: dabawing
Reviews.Content: After staying in Marina Bay Sands last year which was rather disappointing, this time I have chosen three more or less similar boutique hotels to try. The first one is Wangz Hotel. Though claiming itself located in Chinatown, it's actually located about 10 min walk from Outram Park MRT station. It's not bad to walk if it's not too hot, but a bit tiring when dragging the luggage. Room design (though with a "unique" L-shaped layout) is quite nice, with complimentary soft drinks and WIFI as well as breakfast. However, the biggest problem was the WIFI in Room 201. The signal was simply too weak, I could hardly connect to the internet, or even search the network. Before I went out of the hotel, I called the front desk to check. In late evening, unfortunately, it was not still working. The front desk claimed to have tested in the afternoon which should be working. Since the problem persisted, the front desk offered me to have another check again the next day, which was totally understanding at 23:XX. The front desk promised me to have someone to check at around 09:00-10:00 when IT returned to duty. The next day after breakfast, I called the front desk again. To my surprise, the answer to my problem about weak WIFI was due to certain error of the router. From that moment, I doubted if they did check the day before or just fooling me around. Anyway, they offered me to have room move to another room 205. This is much better one in terms of layout which is rectangular so more practical. WIFI signal was luckily strong enough for normal browsing. I did appreciate the effort of trying to rectify the problem. Overall, I quite enjoyed my stay (in room 205). In particular, I like the iPod docking with remote control so I can control the music without the need of sitting in front of the desk. Bath amenities were using "Molton Brown" which are one of the highlights too. I did miss the chance to check out the bar though, which was unfortunately closed at midnight for Friday and Saturday when I returned.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there if you want to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: netsrac99
Reviews.Content: All in all a very good and very stylish new hotel. Nicely modern decorated rooms, very good bathroom, friendly staff at the lobby and the restaurant, good location with easy access to the mtr. But: The main reason why I stay in hotels is to have a sleep at night. And this is almost impossible in the Wangz Hotel even if you use earplugs. The hotel is surrounded by two very busy four-lane roads, there is no way to escape from the noise because of the big windows (see hotel pictures). The next morning I spoke with one of the managers of the hotel, he told me that the rooms - even there are only windows and no walls - are not soundproofed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Kerry B
Reviews.Content: Wangz is a well decorated hotel ,comfortable and has great staff. The room is spacious with a great bed and attention to detail. Cleanliness worth mentioning. It also come with a DVD and movies on request. Free Internet and complimentary soft drinks in the room fridge. Nearby many food outlet and some of these outlet open their doors till the early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect service, tranquil rooms”
Reviews.Author: CFWard
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 days, loved the peaceful, calm atmosphere and the intuitive service, anticipating what you wanted. Would definitely stay here again. Good food, great breakfast, nothing too much trouble. Most comfortable bed ever.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay”
Reviews.Author: aliztravel
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 5 nights for business and the hotel is excellent. spacious room with modern deco. free and speedy wifi. Food in hotel is nice with sensible price and extra 20% off for hotel guest which makes it great when i need to stay in hotel and work at night. efficient staff service and friendly. location is ok, next to Tiong Bahru Road where some nice restaurants and cafes locates there, 10min walk to metro station, 15min taxi ride to Orchard Road. there's a rooftop bar yet couldn't enjoy this time. definitely recommend :)

Reviews.Title: “Over priced.”
Reviews.Author: Ems604
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for business and found this hotel to be very disappointing. The hotel is very overpriced compared to other, better hotels in Singapore. The hotel is more on equal footing with a Holiday Inn rather than a Boutique hotel, at almost double the prices. Amenities are basic. The highlight being the rooftop bar, which offered limited range of drinks. The restaurant was sterile, with no ambiance. The Waiters were friendly and accommodating, however the service desk were quite rude and indifferent. The location is at the centre of a busy intersection, so you can hear the noise from the traffic in the room. Although the room was clean, it smelt of dirty drain water unless the air conditioning was kept on. I soon learned why the room was freezing cold after the cleaner's visit. I would not recommend this hotel, unless it was the only available hotel left in Singapore. Unfortunately, this was my experience as I was travelling on business.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alexfamily3714
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel was a great choice for us. We stayed here for 5 nights in September. We look for contemporary design and were not disappointed. Comfy & huge bed, modern glass shower room and spacious, clean room. We really enjoyed the rooftop Halo Bar for the wonderful night view of the city skyline. The food served there from the main restaurant menu was delicious and good value. The thunderstorm that rolled across the city was awesome to watch from the covered area of the Bar. Best of all was the personal greetings and friendliness of the staff. They spoke to us using our names and were prompt with assisting our enquiries. One staff member even loaned us his personal folding umbrella. The breakfast menu suited us well - healthy choices of fruit, muesli, yoghurt as well as cooked dishes. The location is close to Chinatown and we took inexpensive taxis to other places around the city. The staff always called the taxis for us, & we waited only a couple of minutes each time. Yes we would definitely stay there again. The service and friendliness was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: prokofievlover
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot, and it's rare I enjoy staying in a hotel as much as I did staying at Wangz. Everything is great here, but it's the customer service that really stands out. The staff are really friendly and helpful without being obsequious. They even arranged for the shuttle bus to drop me at my office, even though it's not on the regular route. The rooms are superbly equipped. I have a few negative comments: (1) the gym is rather tiny, though well equipped considering the size; (2) it's quite noisy because it's surrounded on all sides by busy roads; (3) the hot water takes a LONG time to start running (turn on the shower about 5 minutes before you want to get in).

Reviews.Title: “Halo Bar, a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: PerthJon
Reviews.Content: If you want an experience with amazing views of the Singapore's CBD with excellent and friendly service and good value cocktails, then travel a little out of the way to the rooftop bar of the Wangz Hotel called "Halo". We enjoyed our first night so much we came back the next. Great live acoustic music and we even took our 11 yr old who enjoyed a couple of mocktails (one on the house as well!) The second night the sole of my shoe came loose as I entered the hotel so they took the shoes away and reglued the soles back on for me! The only critisism was we had to send back the bar snack of Wagyu burgers the second night as the mince was raw inside but overall an fanatastic place. Haven'e stayed in the actual hotel but will consider next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ahotalafolau
Reviews.Content: Wangz is a very nice, quiet boutique hotel with soothing music and super friendly staff. Rooms were clean, food was nice and I really enjoyed my stay. Lost my blackberry (entirely my fault) but everyone jumped up and down to trace my path & find it... and did! I was almost in tears! Advice is that 3/8 of the taxi drivers knew the road of the address (Outram Road) but were not too familiar with the hotel itself as it was relatively new and boutique-y, so its good to memorise "231" ... not a big issue but it is worthwhile noting. Recommend this place to future guests. i'm definitely going to stay here if i come back on work again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service and beautiful rooms but a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor H
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Wangz on the last leg of a 4 week holiday and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The rooms were clean and modern with every facility you could want or need. The staff were friendly and polite and nothing was too much trouble. The only downside was the location - it's sort of in no man's land - but taxis are readily available and it's not too expensive to get to the main attractions. I would have no hesitation in recommending Wangz.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel with excellent cust svc”
Reviews.Author: sasasa12
Reviews.Content: Unlike most of the svc you get in spore when svc staff shows basic courtesy and indifferent attitude, wangz hotel staff are genuine and go the extra mile to make your stay even more pleasant. As a surprise for my birthday which my partner has informed them, they decorated the whole room and even bathroom with rose petals, even one lined with my name, and a pair of towel swan on the bed. Staff was always friendly n taking the initiative to greet us with a warm smile. The room was cosy as well. The buffet breAkfast may not have a wide variety n hotel room without a bathtub but i think the other facilities made up for it. It has been a really pleasant short stay!

Reviews.Title: “Experience it to believe the Awesome quality in hospitality service”
Reviews.Author: anselmc
Reviews.Content: Location is extremely convenient. 10 mins taxi ride to the city. Close to MRT station as well as convenient for families visiting patients in Singapore General Hospital. Food can be easily acquired with the famous Tiong Bharu pau located next door. Do not be fooled by the 4 star ratings of this hotel, as my stay with my family here had proven it's worthy of 6 star from the very start when we first checked-in. The quality of service from each and everyone of the staff here has been superb. Having travelled around quite a number of countries, this is by far the best I've stayed in. Front desk, bar staff personally greets you with your surname. Higher Managements are seen mingling around with hotel guests during breakfast and lunch. Rooms designs are extremely spacious. Practicality with furniture choice has proven worthwhile. The Deluxe room also provides it's guest with 45 degree angle view of Tiong Bharu. Definitely a hotel worth staying, as the staff here prides on the warmth hospitality services which they provide. Job well done team Wangz Hotel Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - theft from room not dealt with by management”
Reviews.Author: Lesur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights. Overall stay as reflected by previous reviews. Location poor, rooms and staff fine. Breakfast very limited. Poor value for money. Far better options in central Sing for the same rate. But absolutely should AVOID. Checked out at 1pm. At 4pm noticed that colleague had left a bag containing wallet, cash, credit and bank cards, ID card plus personal items in the room. Immediately notified hotel and returned to the hotel to retrieve the bag. Hotel front desk asserted that they had checked the room 3 times but had not found the item. Advised that there was nothing further that they could do. Polite but not helpful and making no attempt to get to the bottom of the issue. Had to report the theft myself to the police station as the front desk did not help place the call. In conclusion, avoid this hotel. Theft occurs here and the duty staff have an unhelpfulnattitude in dealing with it. Extremely dissatisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms but the location is not so”
Reviews.Author: Hburn10
Reviews.Content: Redeemed a complimentary night here as part of my belated birthday stuff. And also an opportunity to just relax :) The hotel was sweet to give me a complimentary cake for my birthday, although it was already belated. The lobby was really empty and I had no problems checking in when I arrived at shortly after 12noon as I had requested for early check in. The staff was attentive and even walked to the lift to offer help plus carry my bag for me. Room 501 was good sized with 2 super comfy single beds; fitting in also was a nice writing desk and also another couch-like chair with a clothes rack. The bathroom was nice, albeit a little on the small side. I love the Molten Brown toiletries! There's also a DVD player and ipod player in the room, plus an alarm which i didnt use. One of the pillow case was stained but they very quickly changed it after we called. Requests for ice buckets, extra toiletries etc was also responded to fast. Some of the mini bar drinks were complimentary which I thought was nice. Also free wireless in the room but sometimes the signals are quite weak, depending on which spot in the hotel you're at. No pool, but a very small gym which looked very un-used. There's only 2 dining options in the hotel - Nectar at the lobby level (breakfast venue too) and a rooftop bar Halo. The bar is quite a nice place for chilling out if you get a nice breeze going. Otherwise, a big local market is available 5mins walk away. I was prepared for a sad breakfast spread after reading the reviews and it was indeed quite sad. You get 1 order of your choice of eggs and sausages etc, and the rest of the spread was simple stuff like porridge, one type of dim sum, a small cheese platter, smoked salmon, cold cuts. There's of course fruits, cereals, and coffee/tea. Nothing fanciful but I actually think it fills you up suitably. I have this review as average although I think the rooms are quite good due to its location. I'm a local so its not so bad, but for visitors it may be abit boring here. No shopping within walking distance, although there's Chinatown but a good 3-4 bus stops away. The hotel is also about 10-15mins walk away from the nearest MRT, Outram. If the weather is hot, the walk will feel much longer. This hotel is probably not ideal for a staycation or someone who's a 1st time visitor to our country but will be fine for someone who's looking for a good night rest with good accessibility to the airport (right next to a major expressway).

Reviews.Title: “Nice, New and Not a bad price for Singapore”
Reviews.Author: M-and-D-on-safari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of June and found it was much better than places of a comparable price that we had stayed at in Singapore before. It is a boutique hotel and it was nice to escape some of the card-board cut-out style places in the area. The room was relatively spacious by Singapore standards, the bed was comfy, the bathroom was neat and clean and all the various techno gadgets were in perfect working order. We found the service to be quite attentive and will definitely stay here again when passing through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie2urist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my own for 2 nights and found the staff, the service and rooms excellent. I will be more than happy to stay there again next time I am in Singapore. The food was good and reasonable and the view from the roof bar is brilliant especially in the evening when the lightning storms are active.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: jcn2045
Reviews.Content: Was visiting Singapore for business with the Ministry of Health, so the location was perfect. Near enough to Chinatown for food, Outram MRT to get around the city -- both about 10 minute walk away. Pearl Hill park 5 minutes away, a surprisingly nice spot to run. Agree it's not great if Orchard Road is your main plan, but overall in a city where a good, quiet room with free Wifi (it's nice not to pay 20-30 SIngapore dollars a day) runs at least 300-400 USD, it's a good value. Bathroom is really small, and it's not a room that would be comfortable for a family. Breakfast is OK, but if you're expecting a buffet like the Ritz Carlton it will disappoint. Basically it's a good choice for a nice bed and modern features at a great price for Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Very unpolite staff”
Reviews.Author: VANBREDA
Reviews.Content: Despite the nice room ALL the rest does not meet standards. Breakfast not fantastic. Very little space to' welcome possibile visitors. Far from mtr AND also too much noise in the evening from close by pubs. On top i have requested late check out at least at 8 pm with half day charme which is widley accepted. Only 6 pm! With meetings during the day AND very late flight it not accettabile by business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Swanky, chic inclusive room with relaxing environment...”
Reviews.Author: 1969AMS
Reviews.Content: Only one night for me in this hotel which proved to be such a refreshing change to the standard box room for most standard international chains. STAFF: genuine and friendly, ROOM: spacious and boasted a nice audio visual system with cool tunes piped through the room, great for waking to or relaxing from any stress. Bathroom was great for exhibitionists with a great view out (and probably IN) the window!! MINIBAR: great mini-bar offering free soft drinks and a wide selection of tea and coffee with liquid creamer, a real plus for tea-drinkers like me who loathe the 'talcum powder' that passes for creamer. BAR: wonderful open air bar offering a 2for1 drinks the night I visited. DINNER: exquisite set dinner which would have cost three times more along Orchard or some trandy resto in Holland Park. BREAKFAST: nice buffet selection and modest offer of cooked breakfast which was tasty, cooked to my request COMMENT: there were lots of freebies I didn't indulge in, making the room rate on offer a GREAT value. Handing in expenses as a business traveller is simplified because many items are FREE - internet, wide mini-bar, local calls which larger hotels squeeze out of us unfairly

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: SleepingBeauty8000
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 days. Picked this hotel because the hotel was in operation only for 1-2 years. So I expected the room decor should still be new and clean if managed properly. In contrast to the photo on their website, the hotel was actually a low building with less than 6 floors. Being at the corner of 2 busy streets, the traffic noise could be substantial depending which direction your room faced. I had a room on 2nd floor facing the alley. Thought this would be more quiet but at 7 am, you could hear banging noise from the garbage truck when it came to collect garbage. The room's decor looked fairly new as expected, but saw pieces of hair on the room and bathroom floor, and so called Housekeeping to vacuum thoroughly. Room and Bathroom were large but for a room rate equivalent to Int'l 5 star hotel, the value for money is not good. There wasn't enough light to work at the desk and so had asked for additional lighting. They bought a lamp. The water in the shower was slow and not hot and so had an engineer to tune or fix the issue. Bed was comfortable as they use Sealy Posturepedic mattress which was the main reason I chose the hotel. Location wise 5-10 minute walk and 1 bus-stop away to MRT. There is a nearby Hawker center for food. Service is below average as one would find that the service level was not consistent. Some staff were helpful, while others weren't. This hotel should lower price by another 30% to make it worth the level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Modern decor; pathetic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ToniYuen
Reviews.Content: Not for first-timers to Singapore; 15-min walk from Outram Park MRT. Be mindful that not all taxi drivers know the place (but they do know Links Hotel right around the corner). Pros: Friendly reception staff. Modern decor and spacious rooms. Comfy bed. Near Tjiong Bahru market - the best non-touristy hawker centre in town. Cons: Breakfast is pathetic (I would say just skip it). Thin walls. Not much sight/scene nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Travelman9999
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at Wangz. The service was outstanding - I had a problem with the sink in my room and literally 1 minute after I rang the front desk the concierge came up and 2 minutes after that a technician came and they fixed my sink within 5 minutes. Super friendly staff, even for Singapore which is renowned for great service. Breakfast is a bit light on but adequate. Room was really funky and the shower was very cool. Stayed 2 nights for business, close to business district. A 10 min cab ride to Orchard Road so no probs there. There is a hawker market just round the corner which has a bun place which is really cheap and the quality of the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back!!”
Reviews.Author: NgHoMan
Reviews.Content: A good boutique hotel with fair price. Clean and nice room. The only thing to be mentioned is that it takes like 10 mins walk from there to the metro station

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JB8080
Reviews.Content: The best service I have ever encountered. Hotel is also very nice. It is quite a small hotel that offers a very personal service, they are very accommodating to all your needs. Will def recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jwtong
Reviews.Content: Decided to indulge and splurge on a 1 night stayover at Wangz. Best decision ever. I knew it would be a great experience the minute I walked into this nice, modern hotel. The staff at front desk, Frank was excellent. In fact all of them were good. They were all extremely helpful, very professional, polite and friendly. The room was great. Very spacious and comfortable. Breakfast was very nice as well. Complimentary minibar (non-alcoholic drinks only) and wifi internet were plus points. One thing i must mention is that the in-room dining menu is excellent! Great choice and variety. Definitely a must try. A pity i never got to try the Halo lounge on the rooftop. Am sure it would have been awesome! All in all, an extremely nice hotel worth everu cent you pay! Try it!

Reviews.Title: “Wangz Hotel - a hidden gem in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: traveler514
Reviews.Content: I recently visited my family in Singapore and found Wangz hotel through Expedia. I was attracted to its architecture and designs. To my surprise, the room was very spacious, clean, modern and chic; breakfast with tropical fruits was also included, and the staffs were very friendly, knowledgeable, and capable to delivery the services. It has certainly exceeded my expectation. I will return to Wangz hotel for sure. If you are looking for a bang of your bucks in Singapore, you ought to consider Wangz Hotel. The only callout to you is that most taxi drivers are not aware of this hotel, you have to bring the map of the hotel to show them.

Reviews.Title: “A very happy stay at WANGZ...”
Reviews.Author: vfmtraveler
Reviews.Content: Very walkable (about 400 Mts) from the Outram Park MRT. Hotel does not change money, but pearl centre adjacent to the MRT has a money changer. Outstanding staff - they go out of the way to delight you. When they learnt we were looking for a vegetarian meal, they ordered one for us from a nearby restaurant. Breakfast is ample - what might make it more complete are a selection of breakfast nuts and a non citrus juice. The hotel rooms are excellent. Spotless, excellent airconditioning and a nice minibar some of which were free. Internet is reliable (and free). Shower/toilet is excellent - some may not like the frosty glass - but it does offer more than enough privacy than I feared. The location is not like Orchard Road or the like - it is very much quieter requiring an MRT ride of a taxi to head out any evening - but if you are one of those (like us) who do wish to respect the neighbour's toe and stay back once you head to the room - the WANGZ is a great choice and offers excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Eveline_K
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel around the corner of Chinatown! Lovely and comfortable rooms and very friendly staff that helped us with all our wishes. Enjoyed our stay very much!

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel with warm and welcoming hospitality.”
Reviews.Author: Wayne_phua
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for a short getaway,although the location is a little hard to find. Very nice overall interior decor. Friendly front desk staff. 2 THUMBS UP!! :)

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel and team”
Reviews.Author: hdadv
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wangz for 8 nights end of March beginning of April. The Wangz is a boutique hotel located on Outram Rd and Tiong Bahru Rd. The nearby Tiong Bahru neighborhood was a pleasant surprise. Just walk out of the hotel in you are in the neighborhood with with plenty of charming shophouse restaurants, quiet lanes, heritage buildings... A nice hawker center is also nearby. The Wangz is located conveniently close to Outran Park MRT station (5-10min walk). So access to main Singapire attractions and business areas is convenient. The Wangz Hotel building presents a unique interesting architecture and has a nice roof top bar with impressive views over the Tiong Bahru neighborhood and Singapore skyline. The rooms are big compared to other Singaporean boutique hotels. The bath rooms includes also a rain shower and equipped with high quality accessories. The maintenance of the rooms and public area is very good. I was very pleased with the service. That includes house keeping ( which upon my request provided me extra bottles and water and continue to do so during all my stay). They have provided me breakfast even though I arrived after the closing hour. The stuff is very welcoming , efficient, and responsive. It is a cosy atmosphere where the stuff addresses me personally by my name and showes a lot of care. I am experienced traveller and in particular I have stayed many time in hotels in Singapore including boutique hotels, I have found the Wangz team and service outstanding. That adds to all other merits of thus hotel and I would certainly will come back to the Wangz and recomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 Stars Hotel for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: Sabah_Girl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Superior Room of Wangz Hotel for a night. Nice little boutique hotel with 41 rooms. Staff are pretty attentive. The building is newly renovated, all in rooms amenties are brand new with modern furnished. Upon arrival, they sent a fruit platter into my room. Wow! Thats the best fruit platter i have received! With a huge mango (taste excellent too!), avocado, Grape Fruit & Apples. I recommend this hotel for couples or single traveller. The Shower amenties are good. The bathroom is that it is built out of glass door & wall, it is snowy tinted by it is still awkard if you are sharing a room with a friend. Room is nice, it is surrounded by glass wall which you could just pull down the curtains for privacy. For other times, having the curtain opens makes the rooms looks roomy and pleasant. Breakfast was OK. Pretty plain. They served breads, salad, eggs & some cereal. The nearest station would be Outram, it take around 10mins walk. Front Office staff is pretty attentive, i was mumbling about not having small notes to my partner, the front office lady first reaction was to offered changing the big notes for me. I would love to give a big thumbs up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Chase1979
Reviews.Content: Spend 1 night at Canopy Room, room is consider big for a boutique hotel. Area in the bathroom is large and it comes with a bathtub. Free WiFi and mini bar is included but parking and the buffet BF is quite limited. Worth staying again if the price is reduced :)

Reviews.Title: “Funky, fresh hotel with pleasant helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: on_da_edge
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, with very freidnly and helpful staff. They were on hand to advise us about any transportation, shopping tourist questions and they always had the correct information. We would definately return to this hotel, loved it! Also great seafood restaurant just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Clean”
Reviews.Author: Helenww
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean hotel located a short walk away from MRT. Hotel staff polite and helpful, booked us taxi's and a trip to the Singapore night zoo. Breakfast was included in the price and was very tasty. Free bottle water left in the rooms each day. Wifi in rooms and access to a computer in the lobby. The hotel let us leave our bags at the hotel during the day we check out which was handy as we had a late night flight. Cocktail bar on top of the hotel was reasonably price and has a nice view and we got given free shots.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ical_85
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in superior room of Wangz Hotel. The staffs were very friendly, they always smile at us every time we met. We checked in quick and the room was so comfortable and very clean. They also offered free internet both wireless and wired, free 2 can of softdrink, free 2 cans of juice and free breakfast for 2 persons. But the bathroom quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: green_grassMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Wangz Hotel at the end of our 2 weeks Asia holiday. Our room was lovely and clean, the staff were eager to assist and best of all was the rooftop bar which has amazing view and at night becomes a great little club. We found most taxi drivers didn't know where it was but if you mention it is near The Link (another well known hotel) they will know where you mean. It is conveniently located just out of the city but the MRT train station is about 10 minutes walk or just get a taxi which costs about the same and is faster.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Modern Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GroverSP
Reviews.Content: Wangz Hotel emerges like a small metal gherkin right at an intersection between Tiong Bahru and Chinatown. The hotel is small, 40-something rooms, and the service is knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. The building is round, and the rooms radiate like spokes off a wheel. That means the rooms are quite unusual, not like your typical big chain hotel, with full length glass windows, stylish showers, and all the typical amenities. Lovely breakfast buffet. Overall, great value and convenience all in one.

Reviews.Title: “Possibly My favourite Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: MarkLaurence
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Wangz Hotel for 2 nights on my way home from Europe to Australia. It was fantastic. The design is smooth and modern. The staff were really exceptional! I arrived early in the morning and the great guy at reception allowed me to check in straight away. The room was amazing - funky design and some wonderful features you do not get in most other hotels - all free. These included: DVD player, IPod player, complimentary drinks in the bar fridge (soft drinks, water, juices, tea/coffee, free high speed wifi internet, free local phone calls, newspaper each day, exceptional bathroom amentiies (Molton Brown products!), continental breakfast that included eggs, bacon etc. I can't speak more highly of this hotel - now the location is not perfect although it is a 20 minute walk to Chinatown and the Outram Park MRT station is only a short walk away. I loved this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Really well designed and a cool hotel!”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireTwig
Reviews.Content: Recommend staying here for anyone really. It's probably not as central as you can get as it's a taxi ride to the centre. But other than that I couldn't fault it. Great rooms and very friendly staff. I stay here again if I came back to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise -- a real find.”
Reviews.Author: jaunting
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights recently on way home from India. It's not in the heart of Orchard Road shopping, but it is only 5 mins by bus or MRT to China Town, Club Street restaurants etc.. There is a bus stop over the road from the hotel, with a choice of about 6 different routes that go via Outram MTR and on to Eu Tong St, Chinatown, and some on to Orchard Road. Its location also makes for a quicker/shorter taxi trip to and from the airport. We arrived after long air trip from Mumbai, via a few hours in Chennai, and were impressed with reception we received, and then the room. We had booked through a discount booking agency so didn't know to ask for a 'front' room (in a round hotel!), so the view from our room was of a small local food hall and bins etc... But no big problem, and not noisy. The room was roomy and very comfortable, with all comforts. Loved the bathroom, no tub which we didn’t miss, but an excellent roomy shower. Only complaint here that the fittings had clearly not been designed with women guests in mind – very small free standing table by the basin, not up to accommodating your average lady’s toiletries and cosmetics!! However, the long ledge at floor level of window proved useful here, just involved a lot of bending! And there was complimentary hi speed internet avail in room. The staff, from reception to breakfast room and Halo rooftop bar were excellent. A particular compliment must be paid to the young ladies working in the breakfast/bistro area and room service delivery – always greeted us by name, and with a 1000watt smile. After a long trip for the first night of our stay we enjoyed an excellent meal in our room, well presented and delivered with a smile. Breakfast in the Bistro was very pleasant, if not the usual gargantuan buffet, all we needed and eggs done on request to suit The ‘rooftop’ bar after dark is also a pleasant change, being completely open air (not enclosed in muted ac cocoon), with efficient cooling, and a view of the night time city sky line to die for.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: everleaf
Reviews.Content: I would highlly recommend this hotel. It is only 5 min walk to the nearest MTR station. Room is very sophiscated designed and built. Staff are friendly and informative. I got a free bed with my reservatio for my teenage girl when I mentioned it was my birthday. I was even given a complimentary birthday cake when I arrived. Very considerate. Room is spotless. Breakfast is good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshingly Good”
Reviews.Author: LILYandSAMHongKong
Reviews.Content: I'm regularly in Sing on business and have become disillusioned with the big hotels. This place is great. Staffs are super helpful; Rooms are large and equipped with free Wi-Fi, basic mini bar drinks, super comfy bed and a great shower. The gym is brand new and barely used. However the real distinguishing point is the uba smiley and helpful staff. The big chain hotels have a lot to learn from places like this. It is also cheaper!!!

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to go home”
Reviews.Author: bestbear
Reviews.Content: Discovering Wangz was the best thing this year!  Like the other reviewers, we found the service top notch, especially Mr Jufri and Mr Mark. Both were conscientious and very very welcoming!  What we like about Wangz is that it tries to be perfect and ensure that guests have the most pleasant experience - hiccups were resolved immediately and special arrangements made for special occasions! During our most recent stay, we encountered a problem with the DVD player and had to change our room. What displayed their excellent customer service and thoughtfulness is that Mr Jufri managed to decorate the new room in a span short of time - as our previous room had candles and whatnot. Every time we stayed at Wangz, we find something new to like about it, from our first stay where a bellhop took the trouble to guide us to the nearby mall, our second stay where to our surprise we were given an upgrade and lastly on our third stay, our room was all decorated beyond our expectations. The service was definitely more personal than the other hotels we have tried.  Our review of the facilities: Checking in and out was hassle free and quick thanks to front desk (Thanks to Mark and Shabir) All pictures and amenities were true to description and the rooms were tastefully and pleasantly decorated. What you see on the website is what you get! Nothing more could be said about how much we enjoyed our stays at Wangz!  It is honestly the best staycation hotel in Singapore... Given the choices of boutique hotels in Singapore, Wangz will always be our number #1! So if you're looking for a new hotel to stay, just book Wangz! You wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “love it!”
Reviews.Author: garlicon
Reviews.Content: pros late check-in but no hassle and fast service! love the room (the bed is comfy with lots of pillows) and the 'rainfall' shower! everything is lovely! complimentary juices + drinks! (in the fridge, make sure u read and understand the conditions*) service is good and fast - accidentally spilled the body shampoo, called for refill and within 5-10 minutes the house-keeping came with a brand new bottle - can't sleep because of the radio that is consistently playing 24hrs, i called the house-keeping at midnight to request for it to be turned off, only to find that there's a switch in the room... and i can turn it off myself. =_= == absolutely love the idea that no matter when and what happened, you can always make a call and someone will help you immediately. :) == cons very limited choices for breakfast and it's the same everyday with little or no variations only one person serving at the breakfast table ( i think she is the cook as well)- short staff? the room is not too 'sound-proof', so beware of hearing funny noises at night! (depends on your room location) the hotel location is not bad, but we had trouble finding it (which exit at the MRT???left?right?)

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel close to MRT”
Reviews.Author: Minkamonka
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and almost three days and had a fabulous time. The FREE WIFI was a real bonus for us. We had stayed at another 5* hotel in Singapore just a few weeks earlier where we had had to pay $30 + taxes for each portable device we used - but not here! Don't be put off by what some people say about the breakfast, as it's plentiful, decent quality and has a reasonable selection of Western fare and not too much Chinese! Fresh fruit which varies each day, 3 types of cereal, choice of pastries (which you can heat up in a little oven), choice of bread for toast and choice of cooked eggs with bacon/sausage etc from the chef. Also good coffee and as much as you like. We didn't eat here for dinner but many locals do as they had a 2 for 1 mains special on and I heard people saying that the food was good. The cocktail bar upstairs was a little noisy for our taste but seemed popular with the local ladies (good place for guys to visit maybe!!). Our room was lovely. We were on the second floor and had a great shower and oh so comfortable bed. We'd just spent three weeks on mostly very hard beds around India and slept for 12 hours the first night, which was just amazing after having had uncomfortable nights elsewhere. Really close to the Outram Park MRT, just a 5-10 mins walk and mostly in shade, so no sweats there. Very close to Harbourfront, just one stop on the tube for Sentosa and Universal Studios etc (which we also visited). Lots of great little places to eat and an interesting and authentic place to stay surrounded by daily life of Chinese people in Chinatown which made a nice change from being surrounded by shops in Orchard Road or the glitz of Marina Square. Small place so you get really personal and attentive service and we were particularly impressed with the staff here which were on names terms by end of first day. The business manager was excellent and all the staff were so friendly. Only thing missing for me was a pool, but I knew that when I booked so can't fault that. They will be opening another Wangz in Orchard area soon apparently which will cater for longer stayers in an apartment style property and this will have a pool - so the Manager told me - so one to look out for! Try it and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: AA_Gull
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. Impeccable staff and service, spotlessly clean and very very comfortable! Room had the best hotel bed I can recall bar none, free wi-fi, great shower in the bathroom and free soft drinks in the mini bar. Extremely civilised.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Exterior. The Room Stank”
Reviews.Author: bibbleabroad
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in October. Booked on the basis of price, Tripadvisor reviews and the interesting looking design of the building. We arrived at 9.40pm, after 11 hours travelling, and were shown to Rm 207, a very large, classy looking room with the end wall entirely of glass. There was a very noisy dehumidifier running and basically the room smelled very damp and unpleasant. There were gaps between the blinds so privacy, most notably in the bathroom, was not assured. Long story short, we changed room but only after being told we might have to return to the original one the next night, also and the new room was smaller because we'd had a free upgrade. No-one had mentioned the upgrade that just got me more wound up. The new, smaller room, 406 was basically fine, and again had a glass end wall. Two foibles - about 3 seconds after the basin starts draining, the sound of water pouring down a very deep well and hitting the surface came out of the shower drain behind us. We also had to keep the bathroom blinds down at all times for privacy from the balcony below. We tried to get some food downstairs just before closing time. They were effectively shut & staff told us the menu was the same as room service, so that's what we did. We later discovered it would have been 15% cheaper to eat downstairs. When the food arrived - mushroom & truffle pasta – it was fine. The daily newspaper and some soft drinks in the fridge were complimentary, the beers expensive. Buy some at a local shop. Breakfast options were limited, but adequate. The following morning Reception confirmed that we could stay in 406 and after that everything went ok. I got the impression that everyone was trying to be especially accommodating to me in all subsequent contacts. But it was all too late in my book. Perhaps the guy behind reception when we arrived was just having a bad day. But they were simply wrong to try to fob me off with a room that wasn't fit for use, particularly at the price they charged. None of this will be news to the hotel management - I told them precisely what I thought when I left.

Reviews.Title: “Poor first impression, but...”
Reviews.Author: pol2vega
Reviews.Content: I must say that contrary to all who stayed, I had a very poor first impression of the hotel. I had known in advance due to my telephone conversation with a staff that parking was tight and was on a first come first serve basis. However, upon driving my car down, I was surprised to find that while the car park was not full, 3 lots had been blocked, effectively leaving me somewhat stranded. This was contrary to what was conveyed to me over the phone. Nonetheless, a staff thankfully allowed me to park at the side. Upon check-in, we politely voiced our displeasure but all we got was some apologies. At that point, I already had second thoughts about staying. Thankfully, the rest of the stay was more pleasant than the check in we experienced. The room was nice and spacious, equipped with a rain shower but a voyeuristic view, not from the inside but from the outside. It was a pity to drop the blinds 'cos the view overlooking Link Hotel was quite pleasant. The facilities provided were very much to our liking, with complimentary drinks and movie rentals, something lacking in other hotels. The amenities included free Wi-Fi and Molton Brown toiletries. Thumbs up here. The location isn't very good for those who want lots of activity. It is smack in the middle of Outram Park. The MRT is about 10 minutes walk away and so is Tiong Bahru market. Apart from that, access to civilization requires a 5 minute drive to Clarke Quay. The hotel facilities were somewhat constrained by the building's original design. As such, there was neither space for a swimming pool nor much room for parking. I don't think there was a gym either though admittedly, we did not check. The furnishing is very new and modern. All in all, the whole experience fits the image of a boutique hotel. Service-wise, the hotel staff was friendly and obliging, They were thoughtful enough to provide a birthday cake 'cos they knew it was my wife's birthday. Many thanks for that gesture. Overall, it would have probably been a better experience had we chosen to stay on a day which did not coincide with a wedding. With better communication, I would probably have given a higher rating. Nonetheless, it's a pleasant place for resting and relaxing. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “good business hotel”
Reviews.Author: ree646
Reviews.Content: i was traveling for work and my colleague picked this hotel. it was in a decent area... a bit tough to find since it was new but had some known hotels in the vicinity. there was no pool so that was dissappointing. the service and people were really nice. food was good. rooms were very comfortable! and showers were great! overall.. good experience. i would stay here again if it was for work but if its for pleasure, i would want a pool! :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: sastreMadrid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in September in this modern boutique hotel and thoroughly enjoyed it. The service was exquisite and the room very modern and of a good size. Breakfast, included in the room rate was just what we needed. We had dinner one evening in the ground floor restaurant which, although very open, has a nice ambience and the food was good. Just one less positive note, the floor on which our room was located had a strong "construction" smell which, whilst certainly not spoiling our stay, should be sorted-out.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Staff "stuff"!”
Reviews.Author: SGWkendTraveller
Reviews.Content: The few important aspects of customer servicing is, - Product knowledge - Friendliness - Patience - Care & Concern for your guests I would like to commend the two guys of Wangz Hotel, Mark from the front desk reception and Jufri, Assistant Manager for those points listed above have been fully showcased by these two gentlemen. What started out as a research for a nice weekend getaway got a little difficult as all the other hotels like Link Hotel and Scarlet Hotel Singapore didn't quite have very good staff who can handle conversations very well. Let me proliferate my point. I spoke with Mark at about 4 to 5 plus in the morning after getting horrible, impatient and lousy language spoken replies from the other two hotels. He was very knowledgeable on the room amenities, cost price of each room and even down to the room size. He spoke with such patience and explained every detail to me carefully and cheerfully, given the time of the night. The other two hotel receptionists had to put me on hold for the various questions I asked, which were standard questions by the way and each time when they are back in the conversation, they sound impatient and quite eager to end the call. But not with Mark. He even told me which room was more cost effective and which had better view of the city streets. Can you imagine this, a service staff who is more interested in making sure my stay was a happy and worthwhile one and not considering the overall cost price of what I'd be paying? Now, that's what I call excellent service! My decision to finally have my weekend stay with Wangz Hotel was largely due to Mark's professionalism and patience with me. Upon my arrival, I was greeted by Jufri who always had his smile ready for us even throughout the stay. He would constantly ask me if my girlfriend and I enjoyed ourselves and was always interested to know how he can further make our stay a pleasant one. He took time to carefully show us all the rooms that the hotel has to offer and even upgraded us to the Balcony room which in my opinion was an excellent room! The room was spacious, and super chic modern looking. The beds, pillows and blankets were comfy, the TV was huge and was mounted on the wall, lights could all be controlled at the comfort of your bedside. DVD players are by your side where you could get a list of movies from the front desk. The rain shower was an excellent concept that they acquired, giving us guests the feel of tranquility right in the very comfort of our rooms. I love particularly the soft pipe in Jazz music that they have. Back to the service of the staff. I accidentally broke one of the lamp bulbs and the staff were up in double quick time to repair it for us and even cautioned me to watch my steps in case there were very small pieces scattered around. He took time to vacuum every single area around the table and kept apologising that he is taking a long time. I was touched by the fact that even though it was my fault, he could apologise and say that he felt bad for taking a long time to clean up the place. A huge pity I didn't get his name. I left the next day with very high hopes of coming back again because my girlfriend and I enjoyed the place tremendously, highly so because of the excellent and simply perfect customer experience that we had. A month later, I told Jufri that I'd like to book another weekend and I told him it was for my girlfriend's birthday. He went ahead of his jobscope to prepare for us a complimentary cake, asking me which flavour she likes and what her name was. Most places I know would not bother about making sure the flavour of the cake was correct and they would much less bother about the birthday person's name. Jufri was sweet and detailed, making sure that the cake was chocolate and non spongy. He even asked if I'd like wine, sparkling or champagne. This indeed made me feel like a very valued guest to them. The room I got this time was the Soak Room and it was like a palace. Everything was just like the first room, clean and neat when we arrived and Jufri arranged for the room to be decorated for my girlfriend's birthday! Good job! The bathtub was huge and the water pressure of the washroom was good and strong and the fluctuations of the temperature were quick, unlike other hotels' which takes a longer time. Overall, my stay has been very pleasant, and I'd like to reemphasize on the top notch service quality from the staff of Wangz Hotel, obviously attributing it to Mark and Jufri. The face of any industry will always begin with the staff that they have and these two chaps are indeed the pride of Wangz Hotel. Keep up the good work gentlemen and I foresee your hotel to be one of the best if not The Best boutique hotel in Singapore! A. Ng

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: libero7
Reviews.Content: Such a great hotel, we stayed in a beautiful, trendy, modern room with a little balcony. Great modcons in the room and a nice shower. Staff were just so unbelievably friendly we were sad to leave - they honestly couldn't do enough for us and were very smiley and generous. Breakfast was quite nice. Location is a bit different and you do need to walk a while or take a cheap cab to shops and restaurants but the neighbourhood away from the main roads is actually very nice for a stroll and a glimpse of real Singapore life.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LovingLifexx
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here on our way to Malaysia. We were picked up from the airport by the hotel and transported effortlessly to our room. The room was more spacious than we expexted, and beautifully decorated with a large comfy bed. The bathroom was immaculate with Molton Brown toiletries a real bonus! and great shower. The hotel is within ten minutes walk to the tube (Outram Park) and travel on the tube is so cheap and easy, a great way to get around the city. Instead of paying for a taxi back to the airport we went on the tube and it cost less than £5, and took around 40 minutes. Drinks in the hotel are quite expensive 2 Tiger Beers around $26 but the bar is nice and open. Breakfast was OK. The staff were vey pleasant and effecient. The room we had was noisy due to the hotel being near the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant & trendy boutique hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: FoodEnthused
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Deluxe room for two nights. Upon checking in, we were pleasantly surprised with the size and style of the room - it was spacious, cool and cozy, while the bathroom was roomy with a nice rain shower and supplied with Molton Brown products. The bed was very comfortable, free WiFi was very useful for us, and we enjoyed the pipe-in jazz music in the room throughout the day. We also liked that we could borrow DVDs for free from the reception. Our only complaint is the noisy gushing sound of water on the ceiling, which came in all hours and kept waking us up in the middle of the night. Some sort of gutter problem? We also found the slamming of heavy doors of other rooms to be rather bothersome, but our episode could have been the exception as our floor had a group of young people running between their rooms. Service was very pleasant, the staff were friendly, helpful and made it a point to address us by name. Breakfast was simple but sufficient. Parking within the hotel is very limited, but we were lucky to always find a space. The location of the hotel may not be the best, but meals at the Tiong Bahru market and nearby restaurants are highly recommended. We would definitely come back to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff who really know the meaning of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: HarimauTerbang
Reviews.Content: The staff did absolutely everything possible to make my stay a perfect one and were helpful beyond comparison - from check in, daily operations, to final departure, as mentioned in my tweets. I also appreciated all the many little extras. The bed was impressive - such a deep sleep that I nearly slept in for a couple of important meetings. And the free wi-fi is perfect for anyone on a business trip. So good I'd like to see Wangz up for an Award. It was even better than the Castle Steps in Prague!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms!! Location and value for money, not so good...”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaAngie
Reviews.Content: What an amazing bed!! Super comfortable. Very nice and new rooms. Very clean and modern. The oly bad things: location (quite far away from everything) and value for money (Very expensive!)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: Thalia49
Reviews.Content: Spotlessly clean and modern hotel. Centrally situated in Chinatown, only 10 mins walk to Outram MRT station. The service was excellent, free internet a bonus. Room with tea and coffee, free soft drinks in minibar, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, safe, bathrobe, slippers, nice rain shower. The breakfast was simple, but adequate and included eggs done to your liking. We could not fault anything and had a very pleasant and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant hotel with very courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: p0tter82
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Wangz Hotel for a weekend getaway. Overall it was a pleasant experience. Upon check in (which was very fast & fuss free), I was upgraded from the Deluxe Room to the Canopy Room. The room is spacious with ample amenities. The bed is probably the most comfortable one that I've tried and I've been to other boutique hotels in Singapore like Naumi, Quincy, & Capella @ Sentosa. The duvet & bedcover is very soft & the pillows are fluffy and nice. The bathroom is spacious with rainshower & a lighting magnifying mirror for easy application of makeup/skincare. The minibar items that are not free are actually very reasonably priced. In fact, I daresay it is around the kind of price you will get if you go to a Singapore supermarket. For example, the Toblerone (medium size) is about SGD2++, the Snapple is SGD3++. The staff are very courteous & friendly without being over-eager or too 'in your face'. Although the location is not really in the city centre but I kinda like it, there is a Cheers convenience store at the Link Hotel next door, it is near to the excellent Tiong Bahru food centre & literally next to the hotel (at the Outram Rd side), there are a few shophouse eateries incl. the famous Tiong Bahru Bao. The hotel stay comes with these complimentary stuff: -WIFI & wired internet access -non alcoholic beverages from the minibar + coffee/tea -continental breakfast -Molton Brown toiletries Just a few minor complaints: -as there aren't many facilities like swimming pool or sauna/spa, there may not be much to do for locals who stay there for a weekend getaway. Although they do offer DVD selection & Playstation so that's something -I personally would like it if I can connect my laptop to the TV but the TV is kind of bolted to the wall & there are no visible ports to connect to laptop. I asked the staff but there was nothing he can do & he apologized profusely for this, which I thought was very courteous. -the breakfast selection is very limited. My stay included continental breakfast & when I got to the 'restaurant', there was not much pastries to choose from. Not sure if in the first place it was provided as I only saw wholemeal bread types. -I could hear the sounds coming from the opposite room which was pretty close to mine. Seems that the guests invited some friends over & they were having some sort of celebration late at night. I have no issue with that except that the rooms are not as soundproof as I want them to be. The security guard somehow found out about the noise & warned them but I kind of expected that the rooms would be more soundproof. I stayed at other hotels before incl. the types where people like to have celebrations inside their room & I never had this problem Overall it's a nice hotel, would have liked it if they have more facilities & offer more services especially for local getaways but it's not at all a bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: WestAussie2010
Reviews.Content: Ultra modern rooms. Staff very pleasant and helpful. Located walking distance to MRT and Chinatown. Bus stop out front. Breakfast adequate. As the hotel is fairly new, make sure you have address or tell taxi driver it's next door to Link Hotel. If you are going to the new Casino make sure you take your passport or strictly NO ENTRY! Room service is restaurant quality and affordable.

Reviews.Title: “memorable stay”
Reviews.Author: JonathanWong
Reviews.Content: it is certainly one of the most fashionable hotel in Singapore.
