Instead of staying in a 5 star standard hotel, i chose to stay this boutique hotel, both for saving cost and traveling differently. My room is superior style, which is ironically the cheapest one,and it is indeed a little bit small, though space is adequate. Design is good, especially the bathroom. As some of reviewer mentioned, Wangz room receives hotel music from it public speaker system. Of coz you can turn it off or down, but the music they chosen is indeed nice melody and quite good to accompany you to sleep. Location is convenient and people there are helpful. The Halo rooftop bar is certainly a best place to relax after a full day appointments. The large and crispy projection screen makes it the wonderful place to watch world cup. The only con of my two days stay is the breakfast, choices are too limited. anyway, it is a wonderful stay in Wangz hotel, one of the sexiest in town.

Reviews.Title: “Different, amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: Janulik
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands out just by the architectural design, it's round and made of metal. The hotel is very small and very modern. The staff were amazing, they all remembered our family name and were very friendly and helpful. The room was lovely with beautiful bathroom. We stayed in two rooms, the first one faced some small back street with outdoor eateries. The problem with this room was that every morning around 7 the bin collectors came and made terrible noise emptying the bins. First morning we thought it was just that one but when it happened the next morning we asked for another room. This room was very similar in design and on the same floor but faced the main road. No bins there :) The hotel is a walking distance to Outram MRT, takes about 10 minutes to walk there. The breakfast was included but was nothing special, the usual toast, bacon and eggs, yoghurt... Try the rooftop bar in the evening, it's very nice. The best thing about this hotel is the staff and the free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: rustycycle
Reviews.Content: The Wangz is a new hotel, however it is not a new building, but rather a refurbishment of an old building with the resulting flaws that this brings. The staff provide an excellent service, but being a small hotel services can be limited. It is unknown to taxi drivers, yet too far to walk from the nearest train station in Singapore's heat or rain. Breakfast was poor. Considering that the price was not much cheaper than downtown 5 star hotels, and its poor location, the value for money is not worth the extra effort required to stay there, just to save a few dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: staycation79
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a staycation and explored the nearby market for meals. The room is neat and well designed. There is a 42" LCD TV with dvd player. The rain shower in the toilet has excellent water pressure. My only gripe was that the breakfast selection was rather poor. But that's not an issue with the wonderful Tiong Bahru Market nearby. There is free wireless broadband which was a plus and a ipod dock in each room.

Reviews.Title: “Unique name, unique hotel”
Reviews.Author: 11black
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. Everything is modern and well finished. The rooms are about the size you would expect and fit in with the style of the hotel. The bed was very comfortable with many pillows supplied. Had a very good sleep and didn't want to get up early. The staff is very friendly and professional. The hotel itself is not large. The restaurant is located next to the lobby. The hotel has a gym, albeit very small, but it does have some free weights and a running machine. No charge for wifi which is a nice change. The hotel does lack an appropriate area to drop off guests. I could tell the hotel staff were aware that this is a flaw and they do their best to overcome it. For some who are a little picky about their service, this may be a slight slight issue. I found that every taxi driver I had didn't know the hotel. I suppose that is a sign of how new it is. I remembered what it looked like in the photo on the website and this helped find it. So make sure you have the address and let the taxi driver know it is next to the Link Hotel. It is by no means a large Sheraton style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great baby friendly service”
Reviews.Author: FredNeal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in May with our 1-year old daughter. The staff were exceptionally helpful and provided a crib, bathtub and baby soap without needing to be asked. Our room was spacious and clean allowing for our daughter to crawl around. Service was fantastic and the rooms were clean and comfortable. Unlike most other hotels I have stayed in, Wangz provided complementary water, juice and soft drinks from the mini-bar which was a nice change. They also loaned us an umbrella when they saw we would be going out in the rain. The hotel is located about a 10 minute walk from the Outram Park train station which is a little bit far for Singapore (especially if it is hot and you are hauling your luggage and a baby), but buses and taxis are available from the train station. A taxi from the hotel to the station cost us about $3 SGD. It is a fairly new hotel, hopefully they can keep up this level of service. As it stands I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: leslieandvicky
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel with my wife &19 year old son & his girlfriend for 5 days the staff at the hotel were all outstanding, could'nt be more helpful, a pleasure to stay here and have already recommended hotel to some friends. Hope to get the chance to come back one day soon. Gretchelle and Mohammed were outstandingly pleasant, superb service from them. The rooftop bar was an excellent area to relax in, and the restaurant was good value for money and excellent food . All in all our stay was perfect,

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore?”
Reviews.Author: AndBac
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently around Asia in business and i can honestly say that Wangz Hotel in Singapore is propably the best hotel i have ever stayed in... The hotel is a bit far from the city centre (South) and it doesnt have a swiming pool or business-centre. However, the staff is fantastic and the service incredeble, they make the whole experience! The rooms are very confortable and the restaurant has a simple but delicious menu. I recomend this hotel to everyone i know!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: liketotravel1002
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wangz hotel for four night in March 2010. What a delightful hotel this is. It is small, with just 41 rooms, but cozy. The rooms are quite large with a very attractive bathroom. Each room is decorated with original artwork. Our room has a couple of paintings by a Thai artist. What makes our stay memorable is the courtsey and the helpfulness of the staff. They learnt our names during the first day and addressed us by our names through out our stay. Whenever we needed any information about Singapore, they responded immediately and accurately, with a smile. Our stay also include a complimentary breakfat, which includes fruits and jiuce, coffee, pastries, eggs and breakfast meat. We used the fitness center once and found it to be adequate. The cross trainer is very similar to the one I use at home. We like a small hotel since all the facillities are so close by. There is no long hallway to walk to our room. We went up to the roof top where there is a bar. The view is quite gorgeous, and the setting is very relaxing. We will definitely come back to the Wangz hotel when we travel to Singapore. We can recommend this hotel to either a business person or a vacationing couple.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: TomMansfield
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on return trip from Perth. I was accommodated with a 6am check in, and very courteous check in from the man on duty, Thomas. I got an unasked for room upgrade as well! As I was leaving early next morning before breakfast, I was surprised to be given a sandwich to take away, as I would miss breakfast! The restaurant is great, with a fine menu, and the rooftop bar has great views of singapore. I could not commend the staff highly enough. I will be back. Tom, Dublin, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “5 star luxury hotel treatment by staff - truly wonderful”
Reviews.Author: kayoticlaudia
Reviews.Content: Some one needs to post photos of the bathrooms! What a way to start your day - nothing better than a "dance in the rain". Truly a boutique hotel - my daughter and I could not stop ooing and aaing at the interior design of the rooms. Yes the hotel is very new but even new can be dirty. Wangz is NOT - it is all that a traveler wants, clean and comfortable. What truly stands out is the 5 star treatment by the staff. I have seldom stayed in a hotel where the staff was eager to help. Every single one greeted us by name and with a smile and was attentive to our needs. I never felt that I was actually bothering a member of staff with a request. Although I was not really on a business trip I did make use of the amenities the hotel had to offer. Printing service and free WiFi! Keep it up Wangz Hotel Staff!!

HotelInfo.Name: Wangz Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 231 Outram Road, Singapore 169040, Singapore
